thread.title: Check out what a feminist bookstore did to male-authored books in honor of Women’s History Month
thread.title_full: Check out what a feminist bookstore did to male-authored books in honor of Women’s History Month

title: Check out what a feminist bookstore did to male-authored books in honor of Women’s History Month
text:
Tweet 
A feminist-focused bookstore in Cleveland is giving female authors special attention for Women’s History Month — by turning all fiction books by male authors with their spines facing inward on shelves. Here’s what a bookstore would look like with no male authors, ft. Shaker Heights @loganberrybooks : https://t.co/eyVsvlM3ZT via @TheAVClub 
— Amanda Bates (@mandibleCLE) March 7, 2017 
The process of going through about 10,000 titles took the all-female staff at Loganberry Books about two hours to complete, WOIO-TV reported , adding that the male-authored books will stay that way for the next two weeks. 
“Truly, this is a metaphor of silencing the male voice,” longtime owner Harriett Logan told the Cleveland Scene . “At least for this month.”
